passageHtml: As humans venture further into space and remain there for longer periods of time, medical issues may become more common and taking a trip back to Earth to treat them less likely. Researchers from the University of Louisville, Orbital Medicine, Purdue University have been working on technologies that aim to control and contain bleeding and __________ surgery in space.
passageText: As humans venture further into space and remain there for longer periods of time, medical issues may become more common and taking a trip back to Earth to treat them less likely. Researchers from the University of Louisville, Orbital Medicine, Purdue University have been working on technologies that aim to control and contain bleeding and __________ surgery in space.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

A.html:
A
facilitate
A

B.html:
B
redeem
B

C.html:
C
adopt
C

D.html:
D
survey
D

explanation: A. Choice (A) facilitate is the most logical and precise word to fit in the sentence. Facilitate means to make an action or process easier. Choice (B) is incorrect because redeem means to compensate for the faults or bad aspects of something. Choice (C) is incorrect because adopt means to take someone or something as one's own. Choice (D) is incorrect because survey means to look carefully or appraise.
fullHtml: As humans venture further into space and remain there for longer periods of time, medical issues may become more common and taking a trip back to Earth to treat them less likely. Researchers from the University of Louisville, Orbital Medicine, Purdue University have been working on technologies that aim to control and contain bleeding and __________ surgery in space.
fullText: As humans venture further into space and remain there for longer periods of time, medical issues may become more common and taking a trip back to Earth to treat them less likely. Researchers from the University of Louisville, Orbital Medicine, Purdue University have been working on technologies that aim to control and contain bleeding and __________ surgery in space. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

passageHtml: Wetlands are areas that are __________ by water often enough, but not necessarily year-round, to support wetland plants or animals.
passageText: Wetlands are areas that are __________ by water often enough, but not necessarily year-round, to support wetland plants or animals.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

A.html:
A
launched
A

B.html:
B
surrounded
B

C.html:
C
voided
C

D.html:
D
inundated
D

explanation: D. Choice (D) inundated is the most precise word because it means to overrun or swamp; wetlands are swamped with water. Choice (A) is not a good fit because launched means set in motion by pushing, which makes no sense in this context. Choice (B) surrounded is tempting, but surrounded is encircled rather than overrun, which is more precise. Choice (C) is the opposite of what the sentence suggests: voided means emptied.
fullHtml: Wetlands are areas that are __________ by water often enough, but not necessarily year-round, to support wetland plants or animals.
fullText: Wetlands are areas that are __________ by water often enough, but not necessarily year-round, to support wetland plants or animals. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

passageHtml: Even though he was a giant of the Gilded Age and a steel industry tycoon, Andrew Carnegie did not believe in passing on his wealth to his descendants; in acts of ___________, he donated much of his wealth to charities.
passageText: Even though he was a giant of the Gilded Age and a steel industry tycoon, Andrew Carnegie did not believe in passing on his wealth to his descendants; in acts of ___________, he donated much of his wealth to charities.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

A.html:
A
philanthropy
A

B.html:
B
mercantilism
B

C.html:
C
avarice
C

D.html:
D
insolence
D

explanation: A. Choice (A) philanthropy, which means generosity or altruism, is the best word to fit the context of the sentence. The words even though set up a contrast with "giant of the Gilded Age and a steel industry tycoon," so you are looking for a word that indicates a characteristic that is very different from making money. Choice (B) mercantilism means belief in the benefits of profitable trading, or commercialism, so that doesn't fit the context. Choice (C) avarice, which means greed, and Choice (D) insolence, which means bold rudeness, do not fit the context either.
fullHtml: Even though he was a giant of the Gilded Age and a steel industry tycoon, Andrew Carnegie did not believe in passing on his wealth to his descendants; in acts of ___________, he donated much of his wealth to charities.
fullText: Even though he was a giant of the Gilded Age and a steel industry tycoon, Andrew Carnegie did not believe in passing on his wealth to his descendants; in acts of ___________, he donated much of his wealth to charities. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

passageHtml: Because many new immigrants feel adrift when they arrive in a new country and seek comfort in familiarity, they ____________ communities in which others from their native country have made their homes.
passageText: Because many new immigrants feel adrift when they arrive in a new country and seek comfort in familiarity, they ____________ communities in which others from their native country have made their homes.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

A.html:
A
compensate for
A

B.html:
B
scrutinize
B

C.html:
C
repudiate
C

D.html:
D
gravitate toward
D

explanation: D. Choice (D) gravitate toward means to move toward or be attracted to; it is the logical choice to complete the cause-and-effect relationship established by the word Because. Choice (A) compensate for (to make up for a loss), Choice (B) scrutinize (to examine carefully), and Choice (C) coexist (to exist in the same time and place) don't fit the logic of the sentence.
fullHtml: Because many new immigrants feel adrift when they arrive in a new country and seek comfort in familiarity, they ____________ communities in which others from their native country have made their homes.
fullText: Because many new immigrants feel adrift when they arrive in a new country and seek comfort in familiarity, they ____________ communities in which others from their native country have made their homes. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

passageHtml: The unscrupulous businessman was able to get several local politicians to __________ him as they defrauded displaced tenants of the payments they were entitled to receive under the law.
passageText: The unscrupulous businessman was able to get several local politicians to __________ him as they defrauded displaced tenants of the payments they were entitled to receive under the law.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise phrase?

A.html:
A
procrastinate with
A

B.html:
B
retrench with
B

C.html:
C
collude with
C

D.html:
D
impugn against
D

explanation: C. Choice (C) collude (to work together secretly for wrongful purposes) is the most logical word to fit the context of the sentence. Choice (A) procrastinate means to delay or postpone; Choice (B) retrench means to cut back; and Choice (D) impugn means to oppose or attack. None of these choices fit the logic of the sentence.
fullHtml: The unscrupulous businessman was able to get several local politicians to __________ him as they defrauded displaced tenants of the payments they were entitled to receive under the law.
fullText: The unscrupulous businessman was able to get several local politicians to __________ him as they defrauded displaced tenants of the payments they were entitled to receive under the law. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise phrase?

passageHtml: Although there is a ____________ of surviving contemporary accounts of Cleopatra's competent rule as Pharaoh of Egypt, tales of her legendary beauty abound, most famously featured in the 1963 film Cleopatra, starring Elizabeth Taylor.
passageText: Although there is a ____________ of surviving contemporary accounts of Cleopatra's competent rule as Pharaoh of Egypt, tales of her legendary beauty abound, most famously featured in the 1963 film Cleopatra, starring Elizabeth Taylor.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

A.html:
A
paucity
A

B.html:
B
fa?ade
B

C.html:
C
roster
C

D.html:
D
viscosity
D

explanation: A. Choice (A) paucity means a lack or scarcity of something, in this case surviving documents from Cleopatra's time. The contrast word although clues you in that you are looking for the opposite of "tales of her legendary beauty abound" or are plentiful. The closest opposite to plentiful is paucity. Choice (B) faade is a false front; Choice (C) roster is a list or a plan; Choice (D) viscosity refers to the thickness of a fluid. None of these choices fit the context of the sentence.
fullHtml: Although there is a ____________ of surviving contemporary accounts of Cleopatra's competent rule as Pharaoh of Egypt, tales of her legendary beauty abound, most famously featured in the 1963 film Cleopatra, starring Elizabeth Taylor.
fullText: Although there is a ____________ of surviving contemporary accounts of Cleopatra's competent rule as Pharaoh of Egypt, tales of her legendary beauty abound, most famously featured in the 1963 film Cleopatra, starring Elizabeth Taylor. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

passageHtml:
The following text is from the article, "Are Telomeres the Key to Aging and Cancer," Genetic Science Learning Center (March 1, 2016).

Inside the nucleus of a cell, our genes are arranged along twisted, double-stranded molecules of DNA called chromosomes. At the ends of the chromosomes are stretches of DNA called telomeres, which protect our genetic data, make it possible for cells to divide, and hold some secrets to how we age and get cancer.

Telomeres have been compared with the plastic tips on shoelaces, because they keep chromosome ends from fraying and sticking to each other, which would destroy or scramble an organism's genetic information.

Yet, each time a cell divides, the telomeres get shorter. When they get too short, the cell can no longer divide; it becomes inactive or "senescent" or it dies. This shortening process is associated with aging, cancer, and a higher risk of death. So __________
passageText: The following text is from the article, "Are Telomeres the Key to Aging and Cancer," Genetic Science Learning Center (March 1, 2016).Inside the nucleus of a cell, our genes are arranged along twisted, double-stranded molecules of DNA called chromosomes. At the ends of the chromosomes are stretches of DNA called telomeres, which protect our genetic data, make it possible for cells to divide, and hold some secrets to how we age and get cancer.Telomeres have been compared with the plastic tips on shoelaces, because they keep chromosome ends from fraying and sticking to each other, which would destroy or scramble an organism's genetic information.Yet, each time a cell divides, the telomeres get shorter. When they get too short, the cell can no longer divide; it becomes inactive or "senescent" or it dies. This shortening process is associated with aging, cancer, and a higher risk of death. So __________
questionText: Which choice most logically completes the text?

A.text: watch your telomeres and keep them long!
A.html:
A
watch your telomeres and keep them long!
A

B.text: telomeres tend to be located along the centers of the DNA strands.
B.html:
B
telomeres tend to be located along the centers of the DNA strands.
B

C.text: telomeres also have been compared with a bomb fuse.
C.html:
C
telomeres also have been compared with a bomb fuse.
C

D.text: telomeres that are found outside the nucleus of the cell are more likely to be damaged.
D.html:
D
telomeres that are found outside the nucleus of the cell are more likely to be damaged.
D

explanation: C. Choice (C) is correct because as the telomeres fray, the person ages and gets closer to death. Choice (A) implies that humans have control over their telomeres, which currently isn't true, and is inappropriately breezy in tone. Choice (B) is inaccurate: telomeres are located at the ends of the chromosomes. Choice (D) is inaccurate because telomeres are found inside the nucleus of the cell.

Inside the nucleus of a cell, our genes are arranged along twisted, double-stranded molecules of DNA called chromosomes. At the ends of the chromosomes are stretches of DNA called telomeres, which protect our genetic data, make it possible for cells to divide, and hold some secrets to how we age and get cancer.

Telomeres have been compared with the plastic tips on shoelaces, because they keep chromosome ends from fraying and sticking to each other, which would destroy or scramble an organism's genetic information.

Yet, each time a cell divides, the telomeres get shorter. When they get too short, the cell can no longer divide; it becomes inactive or "senescent" or it dies. This shortening process is associated with aging, cancer, and a higher risk of death. So __________

When they get too short, the cell can no longer divide; it becomes inactive or "senescent" or it dies. This shortening process is associated with aging, cancer, and a higher risk of death. So __________ Which choice most logically completes the text?

passageHtml:
The following text is adapted from the U.S. Department of the Interior Fish and Wildlife Service article, "The Reintroduction of Gray Wolves to Yellowstone National Park and Central Idaho."

The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) has selected a plan, as modified by public comment, and proposes to establish an experimental population rule and reintroduce gray wolves to Yellowstone National Park and central Idaho, if two naturally occurring wolf packs cannot be located in either area before October 1994 or before experimental animals are released. The rule would allow management of wolves by government agencies and the public to minimize conflicts on public lands, effects on livestock, and impacts on ungulate (deer, elk, etc.) populations.
passageText: The following text is adapted from the U.S. Department of the Interior Fish and Wildlife Service article, "The Reintroduction of Gray Wolves to Yellowstone National Park and Central Idaho."The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) has selected a plan, as modified by public comment, and proposes to establish an experimental population rule and reintroduce gray wolves to Yellowstone National Park and central Idaho, if two naturally occurring wolf packs cannot be located in either area before October 1994 or before experimental animals are released. The rule would allow management of wolves by government agencies and the public to minimize conflicts on public lands, effects on livestock, and impacts on ungulate (deer, elk, etc.) populations. Which choice would prevent the reintroduction of gray wolves into Yellowstone National Park?
questionText: The following text is adapted from the U.S. Department of the Interior Fish and Wildlife Service article, "The Reintroduction of Gray Wolves to Yellowstone National Park and Central Idaho."The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) has selected a plan, as modified by public comment, and proposes to establish an experimental population rule and reintroduce gray wolves to Yellowstone National Park and central Idaho, if two naturally occurring wolf packs cannot be located in either area before October 1994 or before experimental animals are released. The rule would allow management of wolves by government agencies and the public to minimize conflicts on public lands, effects on livestock, and impacts on ungulate (deer, elk, etc.) populations. Which choice would prevent the reintroduction of gray wolves into Yellowstone National Park?

A.text: The discovery that no naturally occurring wolf pack exists in Yellowstone National Park in August 1994.
A.html:
A
The discovery that no naturally occurring wolf pack exists in Yellowstone National Park in August 1994.
A

B.text: The discovery that an animal rescue operation has reintroduced a wolf pack into central Idaho in September 1994.
B.html:
B
The discovery that an animal rescue operation has reintroduced a wolf pack into central Idaho in September 1994.
B

C.text: The discovery of one naturally occurring wolf pack in central Idaho and one naturally occurring wolf pack in Yellowstone National Park in July 1994.
C.html:
C
The discovery of one naturally occurring wolf pack in central Idaho and one naturally occurring wolf pack in Yellowstone National Park in July 1994.
C

D.text: The discovery of two naturally occurring wolf packs in central Idaho in October 1995.
D.html:
D
The discovery of two naturally occurring wolf packs in central Idaho in October 1995.
D

explanation: C. Choice (C) is correct because, according to the text, if two naturally occurring wolf packs are discovered in either Yellowstone National Park or central Idaho before October 1994, then the reintroduction will not take place. Choice (A) would allow the reintroduction to proceed. Choice (B) would also allow the reintroduction because this wolf pack is not a naturally occurring one (and it is only one). Choice (D) is beyond the date set for the reintroduction, so it wouldn't prevent reintroduction.
fullHtml:
The following text is adapted from the U.S. Department of the Interior Fish and Wildlife Service article, "The Reintroduction of Gray Wolves to Yellowstone National Park and Central Idaho."

The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) has selected a plan, as modified by public comment, and proposes to establish an experimental population rule and reintroduce gray wolves to Yellowstone National Park and central Idaho, if two naturally occurring wolf packs cannot be located in either area before October 1994 or before experimental animals are released. The rule would allow management of wolves by government agencies and the public to minimize conflicts on public lands, effects on livestock, and impacts on ungulate (deer, elk, etc.) populations.

The rule would allow management of wolves by government agencies and the public to minimize conflicts on public lands, effects on livestock, and impacts on ungulate (deer, elk, etc.) populations. passageHtml:
The following text is adapted from Imaging Marine Life: Macrophotography and Microscopy Approaches for Marine Biology, edited by Emmanuel G. Reynaud (Wiley-Blackwell).

Many new discoveries await oceanographers as they use new instruments and deep submersible vehicles to explore the depths of the ocean. Oceanographers seek to go beyond learning about what exactly is down there in the ocean to learning about what is going on down there. They want to observe the processes that change over days, weeks, seasons, years, or decades. Yet, it is difficult and expensive to send research ships back to the same site for repeat measurements. Consequently, they are establishing long-term ocean floor observatories with arrays of sensors and instruments. Data from the observatories will be sent to shore-based laboratories via submerged fiber optic cables or via cables linked to moored buoys that can transmit data via satellite and then be made available on the Internet.
passageText: The following text is adapted from Imaging Marine Life: Macrophotography and Microscopy Approaches for Marine Biology, edited by Emmanuel G. Reynaud (Wiley-Blackwell).Many new discoveries await oceanographers as they use new instruments and deep submersible vehicles to explore the depths of the ocean. Oceanographers seek to go beyond learning about what exactly is down there in the ocean to learning about what is going on down there. They want to observe the processes that change over days, weeks, seasons, years, or decades. Yet, it is difficult and expensive to send research ships back to the same site for repeat measurements. Consequently, they are establishing long-term ocean floor observatories with arrays of sensors and instruments. Data from the observatories will be sent to shore-based laboratories via submerged fiber optic cables or via cables linked to moored buoys that can transmit data via satellite and then be made available on the Internet.
questionText: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined sentence in the overall structure of the text?

A.text: It explains how the oceanographers will send ships back to the same site for repeat measurements.
A.html:
A
It explains how the oceanographers will send ships back to the same site for repeat measurements.
A

B.text: It presents an alternative way for oceanographers to comprehend the processes that occur within the ocean depths.
B.html:
B
It presents an alternative way for oceanographers to comprehend the processes that occur within the ocean depths.
B

C.text: It identifies a drawback to the plans oceanographers have to install fiber optic cables to transmit data via satellite.
C.html:
C
It identifies a drawback to the plans oceanographers have to install fiber optic cables to transmit data via satellite.
C

D.text: It sets up the explanation for the oceanographers' actions that are presented in further detail in the following sentence.
D.html:
D
It sets up the explanation for the oceanographers' actions that are presented in further detail in the following sentence.
D

explanation: D. Choice (D) best explains the function of the underlined sentence. The oceanographers set up the plan to install fiber optic cables because it is so difficult and expensive to send research ships repeatedly to the same site. The underlined sentence does not explain how the oceanographers will send the ships back to the same site, Choice (A). It does not present an alternative way for oceanographers to comprehend the processes that occur within the ocean depths, Choice (B). It does not identify a drawback to the plans the oceanographers have, Choice (C): instead, it explains the reason why they created the plans for fiber optic cables.
fullHtml:
The following text is adapted from Imaging Marine Life: Macrophotography and Microscopy Approaches for Marine Biology, edited by Emmanuel G. Reynaud (Wiley-Blackwell).

Many new discoveries await oceanographers as they use new instruments and deep submersible vehicles to explore the depths of the ocean. Oceanographers seek to go beyond learning about what exactly is down there in the ocean to learning about what is going on down there. They want to observe the processes that change over days, weeks, seasons, years, or decades. Yet, it is difficult and expensive to send research ships back to the same site for repeat measurements. Consequently, they are establishing long-term ocean floor observatories with arrays of sensors and instruments. Data from the observatories will be sent to shore-based laboratories via submerged fiber optic cables or via cables linked to moored buoys that can transmit data via satellite and then be made available on the Internet.

passageHtml:
Adapted from Biology For Dummies, 2nd edition, by Ren Fester Kratz, PhD, and Donna Rae Siegfried (Wiley).

Guard cells on the underside of plant leaves use osmotic pressure to regulate the stomata (the openings that allow for the uptake of carbon dioxide and the release of oxygen). Some plants that live in very hot, dry environments save water by opening their stomata only at night and storing carbon dioxide in their leaves. Then, during the day when it's hot and dry, they keep their stomata closed, performing photosynthesis with the carbon dioxide they stored during the night.
passageText: Adapted from Biology For Dummies, 2nd edition, by Ren Fester Kratz, PhD, and Donna Rae Siegfried (Wiley).Guard cells on the underside of plant leaves use osmotic pressure to regulate the stomata (the openings that allow for the uptake of carbon dioxide and the release of oxygen). Some plants that live in very hot, dry environments save water by opening their stomata only at night and storing carbon dioxide in their leaves. Then, during the day when it's hot and dry, they keep their stomata closed, performing photosynthesis with the carbon dioxide they stored during the night. Which of the following choices best uses information from the text to explain why the guard cells would keep the stomata closed during the day?
questionText: Adapted from Biology For Dummies, 2nd edition, by Ren Fester Kratz, PhD, and Donna Rae Siegfried (Wiley).Guard cells on the underside of plant leaves use osmotic pressure to regulate the stomata (the openings that allow for the uptake of carbon dioxide and the release of oxygen). Some plants that live in very hot, dry environments save water by opening their stomata only at night and storing carbon dioxide in their leaves. Then, during the day when it's hot and dry, they keep their stomata closed, performing photosynthesis with the carbon dioxide they stored during the night. Which of the following choices best uses information from the text to explain why the guard cells would keep the stomata closed during the day?

A.text: Keeping the stomata open during the day would conserve water in hot, dry climates.
A.html:
A
Keeping the stomata open during the day would conserve water in hot, dry climates.
A

B.text: Opening the stomata during the day in cold, rainy climates would prevent the leaves from releasing carbon dioxide.
B.html:
B
Opening the stomata during the day in cold, rainy climates would prevent the leaves from releasing carbon dioxide.
B

C.text: Keeping the stomata closed in hot, dry climates would allow the leaves to take in oxygen during the night and release it during the day.
C.html:
C
Keeping the stomata closed in hot, dry climates would allow the leaves to take in oxygen during the night and release it during the day.
C

D.text: Keeping the stomata closed during the day in hot, dry climates allows the leaves to conserve water.
D.html:
D
Keeping the stomata closed during the day in hot, dry climates allows the leaves to conserve water.
D

explanation: D. Choice (D) is the best choice because the evidence from the text indicates that "some plants that live in very hot, dry environments save water by opening their stomata only at night." Choice (A) states the opposite of the evidence in the text. No evidence in the text supports Choice (B) because cold, rainy climates are not discussed in the passage. Choice (C) cannot be supported by any evidence in the text.
fullHtml:
Adapted from Biology For Dummies, 2nd edition, by Ren Fester Kratz, PhD, and Donna Rae Siegfried (Wiley).

Guard cells on the underside of plant leaves use osmotic pressure to regulate the stomata (the openings that allow for the uptake of carbon dioxide and the release of oxygen). Some plants that live in very hot, dry environments save water by opening their stomata only at night and storing carbon dioxide in their leaves. Then, during the day when it's hot and dry, they keep their stomata closed, performing photosynthesis with the carbon dioxide they stored during the night.

passageHtml:
Adapted from the autobiography, The Life, Travels, Exploits, Frauds and Robberies of Charles Speckman, alias Brown (1763).

I might make all possible atonement for the injuries I have done to my fellow creatures, in all countries I have committed acts of hostility and depredation innumerable, but I have no interest at all in this; only to warn the unwary, how they shall in general avoid the falling a prey to thieves and sharpers, and make those who tread in my wretched paths, be sensible and be warned in time to sly evil courses, as too truly will they find verified, that the wages of sin is death; besides that of undergoing in their wicked career, what is worse than death, the stings and daggers of a guilty mind: so that let their race be as long as it will, and their illicit practices attended with continual success, yet not one hour of true and solid happiness is the consequence.
passageText: Adapted from the autobiography, The Life, Travels, Exploits, Frauds and Robberies of Charles Speckman, alias Brown (1763).I might make all possible atonement for the injuries I have done to my fellow creatures, in all countries I have committed acts of hostility and depredation innumerable, but I have no interest at all in this; only to warn the unwary, how they shall in general avoid the falling a prey to thieves and sharpers, and make those who tread in my wretched paths, be sensible and be warned in time to sly evil courses, as too truly will they find verified, that the wages of sin is death; besides that of undergoing in their wicked career, what is worse than death, the stings and daggers of a guilty mind: so that let their race be as long as it will, and their illicit practices attended with continual success, yet not one hour of true and solid happiness is the consequence. Which of the following best describes the writer's main purpose in the text?
questionText: Adapted from the autobiography, The Life, Travels, Exploits, Frauds and Robberies of Charles Speckman, alias Brown (1763).I might make all possible atonement for the injuries I have done to my fellow creatures, in all countries I have committed acts of hostility and depredation innumerable, but I have no interest at all in this; only to warn the unwary, how they shall in general avoid the falling a prey to thieves and sharpers, and make those who tread in my wretched paths, be sensible and be warned in time to sly evil courses, as too truly will they find verified, that the wages of sin is death; besides that of undergoing in their wicked career, what is worse than death, the stings and daggers of a guilty mind: so that let their race be as long as it will, and their illicit practices attended with continual success, yet not one hour of true and solid happiness is the consequence. Which of the following best describes the writer's main purpose in the text?

A.text: The writer wishes to atone for the many evils he has committed as a lifelong criminal.
A.html:
A
The writer wishes to atone for the many evils he has committed as a lifelong criminal.
A

B.text: The writer plans to instruct others in the methods of thievery, fraud, and violence so that they may follow in the footsteps of his successful career of evil.
B.html:
B
The writer plans to instruct others in the methods of thievery, fraud, and violence so that they may follow in the footsteps of his successful career of evil.
B

C.text: The writer intends to warn others that a life of crime (such as his) will result in a guilty conscience and little, if any, happiness.
C.html:
C
The writer intends to warn others that a life of crime (such as his) will result in a guilty conscience and little, if any, happiness.
C

D.text: The writer is giving advice to his fellow wrongdoers to avoid capture, to be sly in all their dealings with the law, and to be sure to collect all the wages that they earn in their criminal endeavors.
D.html:
D
The writer is giving advice to his fellow wrongdoers to avoid capture, to be sly in all their dealings with the law, and to be sure to collect all the wages that they earn in their criminal endeavors.
D

explanation: C. Choice (C) best describes the writer's main purpose. Choice (A) is incorrect because he says he has no interest in atonement. No evidence in the text supports Choices (B) or (D).
fullHtml:
Adapted from the autobiography, The Life, Travels, Exploits, Frauds and Robberies of Charles Speckman, alias Brown (1763).

I might make all possible atonement for the injuries I have done to my fellow creatures, in all countries I have committed acts of hostility and depredation innumerable, but I have no interest at all in this; only to warn the unwary, how they shall in general avoid the falling a prey to thieves and sharpers, and make those who tread in my wretched paths, be sensible and be warned in time to sly evil courses, as too truly will they find verified, that the wages of sin is death; besides that of undergoing in their wicked career, what is worse than death, the stings and daggers of a guilty mind: so that let their race be as long as it will, and their illicit practices attended with continual success, yet not one hour of true and solid happiness is the consequence.
fullText: Adapted from the autobiography, The Life, Travels, Exploits, Frauds and Robberies of Charles Speckman, alias Brown (1763).I might make all possible atonement for the injuries I have done to my fellow creatures, in all countries I have committed acts of hostility and depredation innumerable, but I have no interest at all in this; only to warn the unwary, how they shall in general avoid the falling a prey to thieves and sharpers, and make those who tread in my wretched paths, be sensible and be warned in time to sly evil courses, as too truly will they find verified, that the wages of sin is death; besides that of undergoing in their wicked career, what is worse than death, the stings and daggers of a guilty mind: so that let their race be as long as it will, and their illicit practices attended with continual success, yet not one hour of true and solid happiness is the consequence. Which of the following best describes the writer's main purpose in the text?

passageHtml:
The following is from the Florida Health Department article, "Vibrio Vulnificus."

Confirmed Cases of Vibrio Vulnificus in Five Florida Counties 2020-2022

CountyCases in 2020DeathsCases in 2021DeathsCases in 2022Deaths
Broward410021
Hernando611010
Hillsborough103000
Santa Rosa112040
Seminole101011

Bacteria is present in all seawater: seawater contains a minimum of 1,000,000 bacterial cells up to a depth of 200 meters; the number decreases by a factor of 10 as one dives deeper. Vibrio vulnificus, a bacterium that normally lives in warm seawater, can cause disease in those who eat contaminated seafood or have an open wound that is exposed to seawater containing the virus. The infection caused by Vibrio vulnificus may be serious and should be treated immediately.

Vibrio vulnificus, a bacterium that normally lives in warm seawater, can cause disease in those who eat contaminated seafood or have an open wound that is exposed to seawater containing the virus. The infection caused by Vibrio vulnificus may be serious and should be treated immediately. According to the information in the text and the data in the chart, which of the following is true?

Vibrio vulnificus, a bacterium that normally lives in warm seawater, can cause disease in those who eat contaminated seafood or have an open wound that is exposed to seawater containing the virus. The infection caused by Vibrio vulnificus may be serious and should be treated immediately. According to the information in the text and the data in the chart, which of the following is true?

A.text: As the number of cases in these five counties has decreased, the number of deaths has increased.
A.html:
A
As the number of cases in these five counties has decreased, the number of deaths has increased.
A

B.text: More people in these five counties got sick from Vibrio vulnificus in 2021 than in 2020.
B.html:
B
More people in these five counties got sick from Vibrio vulnificus in 2021 than in 2020.
B

C.text: Two counties accounted for more cases in 2020 than all the counties together did in 2021.
C.html:
C
Two counties accounted for more cases in 2020 than all the counties together did in 2021.
C

D.text: In Hernando County, more people contracted Vibrio vulnificus from open wounds than from eating contaminated seafood.
D.html:
D
In Hernando County, more people contracted Vibrio vulnificus from open wounds than from eating contaminated seafood.
D

explanation: C. Choice (C) is correct because Broward and Hernando Counties reported 10 cases in 2020 and all counties reported 7 cases in 2021. None of the other choices are accurate based on the text and the data in the chart.

passageHtml: The tallest building in Vermont __________ the Battle of Bennington, a pivotal victory for American forces on the New England front of the American Revolution.
passageText: The tallest building in Vermont __________ the Battle of Bennington, a pivotal victory for American forces on the New England front of the American Revolution.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

A.html:
A
is the setting of
A

B.html:
B
interprets
B

C.html:
C
proclaims
C

D.html:
D
commemorates
D

explanation: D. Choice (D) commemorates (honors the memory) is the best word to complete the text. Choice (A) is illogical; the building isn't the setting of a battle. Choices (B) and (C) are also illogical; the building can't interpret or proclaim.
fullHtml: The tallest building in Vermont __________ the Battle of Bennington, a pivotal victory for American forces on the New England front of the American Revolution.
fullText: The tallest building in Vermont __________ the Battle of Bennington, a pivotal victory for American forces on the New England front of the American Revolution. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

passageHtml: While a revolutionary crowd gathered outside the Iolani Palace gates on January 14, 1893, Queen Liliuokalani was forced to __________ control of the Hawaiian government. With the Queen dethroned, years of political turmoil followed until Hawaii was officially annexed to the United States in 1898.
passageText: While a revolutionary crowd gathered outside the Iolani Palace gates on January 14, 1893, Queen Liliuokalani was forced to __________ control of the Hawaiian government. With the Queen dethroned, years of political turmoil followed until Hawaii was officially annexed to the United States in 1898.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

A.html:
A
strengthen
A

B.html:
B
relinquish
B

C.html:
C
preserve
C

D.html:
D
overcome
D

explanation: B. Choice (B) relinquish means to give up; this fits with the context clue that the Queen was dethroned. She didn't strengthen (Choice A) control if she was dethroned, nor did she preserve (Choice C) or overcome (Choice D).
fullHtml: While a revolutionary crowd gathered outside the Iolani Palace gates on January 14, 1893, Queen Liliuokalani was forced to __________ control of the Hawaiian government. With the Queen dethroned, years of political turmoil followed until Hawaii was officially annexed to the United States in 1898.

With the Queen dethroned, years of political turmoil followed until Hawaii was officially annexed to the United States in 1898. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

passageHtml: Butch Cassidy and three other men robbed a Telluride, Colorado, bank on June 24, 1889. This robbery was the first major crime __________ Cassidy, who went on to become a notorious bank and train robber.
passageText: Butch Cassidy and three other men robbed a Telluride, Colorado, bank on June 24, 1889. This robbery was the first major crime __________ Cassidy, who went on to become a notorious bank and train robber.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise phrase?

A.html:
A
attributed to
A

B.html:
B
compromised on by
B

C.html:
C
endorsed by
C

D.html:
D
produced by
D

explanation: A. Choice (A) attributed to is the logical choice to fit in the blank; it means Butch Cassidy is credited with the robbery. Choice (B) compromised on by and Choice (C) endorsed by don't make sense. Choice (D) produced by might have tempted you, but he didn't produce the crime; he committed it, so it is attributed to him.
fullHtml: Butch Cassidy and three other men robbed a Telluride, Colorado, bank on June 24, 1889. This robbery was the first major crime __________ Cassidy, who went on to become a notorious bank and train robber.
fullText: Butch Cassidy and three other men robbed a Telluride, Colorado, bank on June 24, 1889. This robbery was the first major crime __________ Cassidy, who went on to become a notorious bank and train robber. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise phrase?

passageHtml: As Prohibition loomed and threatened the livelihoods of brewers across the country, the brewers responded with a series of innovative ad campaigns. Advertising sought to persuade the public by __________ the economic benefits of the brewing industry and the taxes thereon, lauding the health value of "liquid bread," distinguishing beer from hard alcohol, and making philosophical appeals for liberty.
passageText: As Prohibition loomed and threatened the livelihoods of brewers across the country, the brewers responded with a series of innovative ad campaigns. Advertising sought to persuade the public by __________ the economic benefits of the brewing industry and the taxes thereon, lauding the health value of "liquid bread," distinguishing beer from hard alcohol, and making philosophical appeals for liberty.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

A.html:
A
touting
A

B.html:
B
flouting
B

C.html:
C
grouting
C

D.html:
D
gloating
D

explanation: A. Choice (A) is the logical choice to fit the context; touting means attempting to sell or to publicize. Choice (B) flouting means openly disregarding; Choice (C) grouting means cementing in tiles; and Choice (D) gloating means dwelling on one's own successes.

passageHtml:
The following text is adapted from "The Thtre Franais" by Henry James in The Oxford Book of American Essays (ed. Brander Matthews) published in 1914.

On the whole, it may be said that the great talents find their way, sooner or later, to the Thtre Franais. This is, of course, not a rule that works __________ for there are a great many influences to interfere with it. Interest as well as merit - especially in the case of the actresses - weighs in the scale.
passageText: The following text is adapted from "The Thtre Franais" by Henry James in The Oxford Book of American Essays (ed. Brander Matthews) published in 1914.On the whole, it may be said that the great talents find their way, sooner or later, to the Thtre Franais. This is, of course, not a rule that works __________ for there are a great many influences to interfere with it. Interest as well as merit - especially in the case of the actresses - weighs in the scale.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

A.html:
A
apathetically,
A

B.html:
B
erroneously,
B

C.html:
C
unvaryingly,
C

D.html:
D
rancorously,
D

explanation: C. Choice (C) unvaryingly, which means not changing or varying, completes the text; the context clue is "a great many influences to interfere with it." With a great many influences, the rule would be varying, not unvarying. Choice (A) means without caring, Choice (B) means incorrectly, and Choice (D) means bitterly; none of these choices complete the sentence logically.

passageHtml: Seattle is renowned as a city __________ musical tradition - a hub of creativity with a concentration of music industry leaders and musicians representing an expansive array of industry sectors and musical genres.
passageText: Seattle is renowned as a city __________ musical tradition - a hub of creativity with a concentration of music industry leaders and musicians representing an expansive array of industry sectors and musical genres.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise phrase?

A.html:
A
steeped in
A

B.html:
B
meager of
B

C.html:
C
shrouded by
C

D.html:
D
loathed by
D

explanation: A. Choice (A) steeped, which means soaked, is used metaphorically to refer to how much Seattle is saturated with musical tradition. Choice (B) meager (lacking in quantity) is the opposite of what the context suggests. Choice (C) shrouded (hidden by a covering) doesn't fit the context. Choice (D) loathed (hated) also doesn't fit the context.
fullHtml: Seattle is renowned as a city __________ musical tradition - a hub of creativity with a concentration of music industry leaders and musicians representing an expansive array of industry sectors and musical genres.
fullText: Seattle is renowned as a city __________ musical tradition - a hub of creativity with a concentration of music industry leaders and musicians representing an expansive array of industry sectors and musical genres. Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise phrase?

passageHtml: Ragtime music is a popular American style of music known for its syncopated, or "ragged," rhythm. The music style originated in predominantly African-American communities and exploded in popularity by the late 1800s, led by artists such as Scott Joplin and Sissieretta Jones. Ragtime expanded its influence in the early 1900s, finding its way to Europe. Ragtime music had a strong influence on early jazz, ultimately becoming a __________ of African and European music.
passageText: Ragtime music is a popular American style of music known for its syncopated, or "ragged," rhythm. The music style originated in predominantly African-American communities and exploded in popularity by the late 1800s, led by artists such as Scott Joplin and Sissieretta Jones. Ragtime expanded its influence in the early 1900s, finding its way to Europe. Ragtime music had a strong influence on early jazz, ultimately becoming a __________ of African and European music.
questionText: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word?

A.html:
A
anathema
A

B.html:
B
synthesis
B

C.html:
C
hierarchy
C

D.html:
D
prognosticator
D

explanation: B. Choice (B) synthesis, a combination or mixture of ideas, is the most logical word to complete the sentence. Choice (A) anathema means something hated or despised. Choice (C) hierarchy is a ranking system. Choice (D) prognosticator is a person who foretells the future. None of these choices fit the context.
fullHtml: Ragtime music is a popular American style of music known for its syncopated, or "ragged," rhythm. The music style originated in predominantly African-American communities and exploded in popularity by the late 1800s, led by artists such as Scott Joplin and Sissieretta Jones. Ragtime expanded its influence in the early 1900s, finding its way to Europe. Ragtime music had a strong influence on early jazz, ultimately becoming a __________ of African and European music.

passageHtml:
The following text is from "Science through Pop Culture: A Research Guide" by the Library of Congress.

Some of the more memorable media where science played an outsized role came about because of the interest in space exploration and the possibilities that entailed. Movies such as Invasion of the Body Snatchers and War of the Worlds played on the fear of extraterrestrials, while the various iterations of television's Star Trek focused more on exploration, as expressed in the original title sequence, "To boldly go where no man has gone before." Regardless of intent, they brought complex theories of space travel and technology such as cell phones (communicators), computers, holograms, and androids into homes across the globe.
passageText: The following text is from "Science through Pop Culture: A Research Guide" by the Library of Congress.Some of the more memorable media where science played an outsized role came about because of the interest in space exploration and the possibilities that entailed. Movies such as Invasion of the Body Snatchers and War of the Worlds played on the fear of extraterrestrials, while the various iterations of television's Star Trek focused more on exploration, as expressed in the original title sequence, "To boldly go where no man has gone before." Regardless of intent, they brought complex theories of space travel and technology such as cell phones (communicators), computers, holograms, and androids into homes across the globe.
questionText: Which choice best states the function of the underlined portion in the overall structure of the text?

A.text: To provide an example of a television show that utilizes technology.
A.html:
A
To provide an example of a television show that utilizes technology.
A

B.text: To quote a title that epitomizes a facet of science's role in the media.
B.html:
B
To quote a title that epitomizes a facet of science's role in the media.
B

C.text: To reference an example that minimizes true science.
C.html:
C
To reference an example that minimizes true science.
C

D.text: To make an assertion that is expanded on in the next sentence.
D.html:
D
To make an assertion that is expanded on in the next sentence.
D

explanation: B. The text quotes the original title sequence of Star Trek to demonstrate the show's focus on exploration. The underlined portion doesn't reference technology (Choice A) or minimize true science (Choice C) or make an assertion that is expanded upon in the next sentence (Choice D).

Regardless of intent, they brought complex theories of space travel and technology such as cell phones (communicators), computers, holograms, and androids into homes across the globe.

passageHtml:
The following text is from "Endangered and Threatened Species" by the Library of Congress

Extinction of species has occurred as a natural process since life began on Earth, but human activities have greatly accelerated the rate of extinction in recent years. Among the many factors that may contribute to the disappearance of a species are habitat destruction, over-exploitation, introduction of exotic species, and climate change. Endangered animals face extinction in all or a part of their ranges unless specific measures are taken for their protection. Threatened animals are likely to become endangered in the foreseeable future. Endangered mammals and birds have received the greatest amount of attention in conservation efforts to date, but there is a growing recognition of the importance of endangered amphibians, reptiles, fish, and invertebrates, so __________.
passageText: The following text is from "Endangered and Threatened Species" by the Library of CongressExtinction of species has occurred as a natural process since life began on Earth, but human activities have greatly accelerated the rate of extinction in recent years. Among the many factors that may contribute to the disappearance of a species are habitat destruction, over-exploitation, introduction of exotic species, and climate change. Endangered animals face extinction in all or a part of their ranges unless specific measures are taken for their protection. Threatened animals are likely to become endangered in the foreseeable future. Endangered mammals and birds have received the greatest amount of attention in conservation efforts to date, but there is a growing recognition of the importance of endangered amphibians, reptiles, fish, and invertebrates, so __________.
questionText: Which choice most logically completes the text?

A.text: endangered plants, which are also essential to human and animal life, will receive more attention in the future
A.html:
A
endangered plants, which are also essential to human and animal life, will receive more attention in the future
A

B.text: specific measures are no longer needed because the damage has already advanced beyond what can be redressed by human action
B.html:
B
specific measures are no longer needed because the damage has already advanced beyond what can be redressed by human action
B

C.text: birds and endangered mammals are clearly the most significant species and should receive the most comprehensive conservation efforts
C.html:
C
birds and endangered mammals are clearly the most significant species and should receive the most comprehensive conservation efforts
C

D.text: these animals are likely to receive more attention in the future
D.html:
D
these animals are likely to receive more attention in the future
D

explanation: D. Choice (D) completes the text; growing recognition of the importance of endangered amphibians, reptiles, fish, and invertebrates would logically lead to more attention. The other choices repeat information from the text (Choice C), are not logical (Choice B), or bring in irrelevant information (Choice A).

Endangered animals face extinction in all or a part of their ranges unless specific measures are taken for their protection.
